short_summary: Land Use Planning and Development Services
full_summary:
**Land Use Planning and Development Services – Standing Offer (SO)**

**Reference:** MX-43064225653

**Solicitation Number:** UP23900

**Tender Closing Date:** April 23, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST

**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding

**Selection Criteria:**

* Relevance of services offered
* Qualifications of the contractor
* Price and value offered

**Trade Agreements:**

* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

**Standing Offer Description:**

Defense Construction Canada invites consulting firms to establish a Standing Offer (SO) to provide professional services for land use planning and development. The services to be provided include:

* Site Development Guidelines and Land Use Strategies
* Land Use Planning and Development Options
* Financial Analysis for Land Use Development Options
* Civil Engineering Analysis and Development Options

**Standing Offer Period:**

The Standing Offer will be for a period of three (3) years, with a maximum estimated value of $600,000. The Offer may be extended for up to two (2) additional one-year periods and increased by $200,000 for each additional period.

**Tender Documents:**

Tender documents, including the Request for Abbreviated Proposal (RFAP), are available on MERX.

**Eligibility:**

Firms that consider themselves qualified to provide these services are invited to submit their Abbreviated Proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System. Questions regarding this solicitation should be directed to Jacob Lachapelle at jacob.lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or 343-550-4560.

**Award Information:**

Awardee(s) will be announced on the Defense Construction Canada website. Please refer to the website for further information. 

**Language of Procurement:** English, French

**Taxes:**

All applicable federal, provincial, and local taxes will be the responsibility of the chosen contractor.
